title: COMP/STAT212 Portfolio
text: Welcome to my online portfolio for COMP/STAT112 course taken at Macalester College. Please, use the side bar on the left for navigation.

title: Homework 01
text:
TidyTuesday Section
Explore the week’s TidyTuesday challenge. Develop a research question, then answer it through a short data story with effective visualization(s). Provide sufficient background for readers to grasp your narrative.
Research question: How does a company’s size influence the type of legal category it chooses among Brazil’s top 500 firms?
Code# Cleaning the data 
top_companies <- companies %>%
  arrange(desc(capital_stock)) %>%  
  slice_head(n = 500)
Visualizations
Codetop_companies |> 
ggplot(aes(x = company_size, fill = legal_nature)) +
  geom_bar(position = "fill") +
  scale_fill_viridis_d(option = "viridis") + #Used in my final project for COMP112: User friendly
  labs(
    title = "Does Size Influence Legal Nature?",
    subtitle = "A proportional look at legal nature across the Top 500 Brazilian firms",
    caption = "Source: TidyTuesday Challenge Week 4, 2026. Author: Patricia Escobar",
    x = "Size Category",
    y = "Proportion (%)",
    fill = "Legal Nature"
  ) +
  theme_minimal() +
  theme(
    panel.background = element_rect(fill = "white", color = "black"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.text = element_text(size = 10),
    plot.title = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 16, face = "bold"),
    plot.subtitle = element_text(hjust = 0.5, size = 12, face = "italic"),
    legend.position = "bottom",
    legend.text = element_text(size = 7)) + 
    theme_minimal()
The visualization reveals a clear distinction in the legal architecture of Brazil’s top 500 firms based on their size. At the Micro-enterprise level, legal structures are relatively homogeneous, consisting primarily of sole proprietorships and simple innovation models.
As we progress to Small-enterprises, there is a significant shift toward the Limited Liability Business Company (LLC). This suggests that as a firm outgrows the ‘Micro’ stage, it typically adopts this more flexible structure to benefit from corporate liability protection.
However, the most complex diversification occurs in the ‘Other’ category (supposedly representing the largest firms). While the LLC structure remains prevalent, this group introduces much more sophisticated ownership models, such as Privately Held Corporations and Publicly Traded Corporations. This evidence suggests a direct correlation between scale and complexity: in the beginning, very small firms tend to rely on simpler ownership structures, then, when the companies expand, almost all of them are identify as LLC. However, as the companies expand even more in capital and size, they inevitably transition into more robust legal frameworks to manage greater regulatory requirements and investment needs, as seen in the plot.

title: Cleaning SFO Weather Data
text:
Exercise
Carryout the following steps to clean and save the San Francisco Weather data. Make sure to download and add the data file to your portfolio repository as instructed.
Codeweather <- read_csv("data/raw/weather.csv")
Codeweather_new <- weather |> 
    mutate(PrecipYr = na_if(PrecipYr, 99999))
3 & 4.
Codeweather_new <- weather_new |> 
    arrange(Month, Day) |> 
    mutate(dateInYear = 1:365)
Codemonths <- tibble(
    Month = 1:12,
    month_name = month.abb)
Codeweather_new <- weather_new |> 
    left_join(months)
Codewrite_csv(weather_new, file = "data/processed/weather_new.csv")

title: Cleaning SFO Weather Data
text:
Read in the weather data in this file with the correct relative file path after you move it to the instructed location.
There is a variable that has values that don’t make sense in the data context. Figure out which variable this is and clean it up by making those values missing using na_if().
Create a variable called dateInYear that indicates the day of the year (1-365) for each case. (Jan 1 should be 1, and Dec 31 should be 365).
Create a variable called month_name that shows the 3-letter abbreviation for each case.
Save the wrangled data to the data/processed/ folder using write_csv(). Name this file weather_clean.csv. Look up the documentation for this function by typing ?write_csv in the Console. You’ll need to write an appropriate relative path.
